pr_title: Disable the agent when -XX:+UseG1GC is used on Java 7

timeline.message: Disable the agent when -XX:+UseG1GC is used on Java 7

timeline.bodyText: Could we check for tracer state and throw an exception if triggered before tracer has been started ?
timeline.author: SylvainJuge

replies.bodyText:
I didn't want to do any JMX query at initialization time because of my JULI deadlock trauma (this kicks all kind of initializations).
However, @felixbarny feels it is safe enough to do this simple JMX query very early on, as long as we don't try to getPlatformMBeanSerever. It certainly simplifies things a lot (no need to uninstrument classes just after they are done being instrumented). So we'll go with that. I will test and merge the change soon
replies.author: eyalkoren

replies.bodyText: I'd also recommend adding a way to disable the bootstrap checks, for example with a system property, in case it does cause problems. It can't be a config option as these get initialized later.
replies.author: felixbarny

timeline.bodyText:
The damage might already be done at this point. Not even starting the tracer and instrumentation seems to be safer.
To deal with the situation where calling ManagementFactory.getRuntimeMXBean() might cause a deadlock if a JUL logger gets initialized, we could add a flag to disable the bootstrap checks.
But I don't see an indication that any loggers are used when ManagementFactory.getRuntimeMXBean() is called. I would be very surprised if it was the case.
Personally, I would trade this unlikely potential issue that can be mitigated with a flag with the risk that's imposed by first instrumenting and then un-instrumenting JVMs with unsupported flags.
timeline.author: felixbarny

replies.bodyText:
Yes, testing the changes now.
The reason I assume the damage is not already done is the fact that reports we got described a crash that happens some time after agent is loaded, maybe only happen on JITed code 🤷‍♂️ .
